sub_title: International policy professional and advocate, passionate about LGBTQI+ rights, key populations, and inclusive international development.
summary:
Tushar is an international human rights and international development specialist with over 13 years of experience engaging and working with marginalised communities, especially SOGIESC minorities, in 50+ countries across 6 continents.

Tushar has always been extremely passionate about LGBTQI+ rights, sexual and reproductive health and rights of youth and marginalised communities (in their full intersectionality), to further public policy and global development. Having worked at both the grassroots and with international organisations, he brings with him a nuanced understanding of engagement with different stakeholders, a passion for social justice, and the skills to bridge gaps in policy and implementation, to promote development that is inclusive of all.

education.field_of_study: Human Rights & Humanitarian Policy, United Nations Studies

school.name: Bal Bharati Public School, Pitampura, Delhi

courses.name: Management and Administration of Nonprofit Organizations

profile_positions.description:
Research and Advocacy Officer for the Love Alliance, a strategic partnership between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands, Aidsfonds, UHAI EASHRI, AFE, ISDAO, GALZ, Sisonke, SANPUD and GNP+.
Responsible for coordinating the research agenda for the entire alliance, and its uptake by partners, for continued advocacy on advancing the health and rights of key populations in 10 countries across Africa.
profile_positions.title: Research and Advocacy Officer

profile_positions.description:
The Indonesia Healthy Cities with Pride project aims to support the health and rights of young LGBTIQ+ people in all their diversity across the geography of Indonesia. In a country that is geographically, culturally, and politically diverse, the lived realities of LGBTIQ+ youth vary vastly from city to city, from island to island. Aidsfonds is working with two Indonesian grantmakers, who are both led by young LGBTQI+ people, to co-lead on this project and support efforts by movements of young LGBTIQ+ people in 4 cities across Indonesia.

The project specifically works on LGBTQI+ young people's access to HIV services, strengthening community-led services and creating new innovative partnerships, reducing inequalities that hinder an effective HIV response such as stigma, discrimination, violence and criminalization, and improving access to resources and finance for communities for capacity and HIV system strengthening.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
Grants Officer for the Love Alliance, a strategic partnership between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands, Aidsfonds, UHAI EASHRI, AFE, ISDAO, GALZ, Sisonke, SANPUD and GNP+. Aidsfonds is responsible for the participatory grantmaking for advocacy on sexual and reproductive health and rights for key populations in Zimbabwe, South Africa and Mozambique.
Responsible for grants management in Zimbabwe and the Southern Africa region, alongside coordinating Southern Africa regional advocacy strategies and linkages to global advocacy efforts.
profile_positions.title: Grants Officer

profile_positions.description: As the Diversity and Inclusion trailblazer, I am responsible for implementing a D&I plan of action that includes embedding diversity and inclusion in all our internal systems, approaches, and management, promoting diverse hiring that truly reflects society and the communities we work with, and spearheading our ambitions in becoming a more diverse and inclusive organization, both internally as well as in our work in the Netherlands and abroad.
profile_positions.title: Diversity and Inclusion Trailblazer

profile_positions.description:
Leading advocacy initiatives to translate the global societal enabler targets into country-specific targets, investments and concrete actions by stakeholders.

The new UNAIDS Political Declaration on AIDS and the Global AIDS Strategy 2021-2026 were adopted to guide the global efforts to end AIDS by 2030 with a set of global targets for 2025, and for the first time set measurable 10-10-10 societal enabler targets:
o Less than 10% of countries have punitive legal and policy environments that lead to the denial or limitation of access to services.
o Less than 10% of people living with HIV and key populations experience stigma and discrimination.
o Less than 10% of women, girls, people living with HIV and key populations experience gender-based inequalities and all forms of gender-based violence.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
Project Lead responsible for finalisation of the PITCH partnership, a €41 million strategic partnership between Aidsfonds, Frontline AIDS, and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, working with those most affected by HIV in enabling these groups to transform (inter)national HIV responses by strengthening their advocacy skills and capacities and promoting innovative evidence-informed practice.

The partnership ran from 2016-2020 and was implemented through partners in nine countries (Indonesia, Kenya, Mozambique, Myanmar, Nigeria, Uganda, Ukraine, Vietnam, Zimbabwe), two global regions (Southern Africa, Eastern Europe and Central Asia), as well as globally through advocacy (Global Fund, EU, UN, US government, AU) and implementation partners (Free Space Process, The International Drug Policy Consortium, Harm Reduction International)
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
PITCH is a strategic partnership between Aidsfonds, Frontline AIDS and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and supports efforts by local organisations that are led by and work with LGBTIQ people, sex workers, people who use drugs, and adolescent girls and young women to advocate, generate evidence and improve policy in the HIV response.

As the Program Officer for PITCH, my role included the strategic and practical implementation of our programs, coordinating international engagement and mapping synergies with the advocacy and work that PITCH partners (from 9 countries and 2 regions) did, and working towards the sustainability of our partners' efforts to continue beyond the program. My role also involved strategic communications and advocacy, and monitoring and evaluation of the PITCH program. I additionally contributed to strategic planning processes for Aidsfonds’ international department, including diversity initiatives, extended development team processes, and emergency funding mechanisms like the Covid Rapid Response Fund.
profile_positions.title: Program Officer

profile_positions.description:
Team Member with the Decision and Delivery Sciences Analytical Program. Managing programs and developing policy recommendations for national HIV and Universal Health Coverage work globally.
Reporting on World Bank's contributions towards achieving global HIV/AIDS goals to UNAIDS.
Providing analytical and technical writing support for projects pertaining to achieving Universal Health Coverage, especially in HIV and Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR).
Coordinating and organising capacity building initiatives for policymakers, World Bank staff, and other governmental representatives from around the world on health systems strengthening, including the application of data science and technological innovation in the public health response.
profile_positions.title: Team Member, Decision and Delivery Sciences, HNP (Health, Nutrition, Population) Global Practice

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Youth First India project, designing curriculum that fosters development through an evidence-based approach to impact the health of adolescent youth.
Design and development of health curriculum, including facilitator manuals and materials for training of trainers.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Conducted a formative review of GIM's teacher-training program, Ruang Berbagi Ilmu (RuBI), which translates to the “Knowledge-Sharing Platform.”
Over 100 stakeholders were interviewed in one-on-one and focus group settings across Indonesia in South Sumatra, Jakarta, Bima, Ternate, and Tidore districts, a diverse cohort of locations both geographically and socio-culturally. Most of the interviews were conducted with teachers and school administrators in remote rural settings to gain a deeper insight into their motivation to continue this knowledge-sharing in their own communities.
A final report showcased RuBI’s initial outcomes and identifies the program’s strengths and opportunities for improvement, proliferation, and sustainability. Using qualitative methods, this evaluation provided GIM with detailed findings, observations, and recommendations about RuBI in order to further enable RuBI to move forward in an informed direction.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: Columbia University - School of International and Public Affairs

profile_positions.description: Provided technical support at the Office of Academic Affairs at SIPA, Columbia University, as a student officer.
profile_positions.title: Program Assistant

profile_positions.description: Engaging locally with OutRight's global LGBTIQ rights work. Chaired OutRight's Engagement Committee that organizes events to engage upcoming leaders and young professionals passionate about LGBTIQ rights in the New York City Area. These events feature inspirational activists from across the world that OutRight works with, who share their work on the ground fighting against inequality and persecution.
profile_positions.title: Chair - Outright Engagement Committee

profile_positions.description: Recipient of the prestigious Tamer Social Enterprise Summer Fellowship. Men Against AIDS Youth Group (MAAYGO) is an NGO working in Kisumu with key populations affected by HIV/AIDS, and with LGBTIQ individuals. Worked with MAAYGO in capacity building on grant writing, budgeting, social media strategy development. Worked with the Health Minister of Kisumu County and MAAYGO to develop a joint proposal for a dedicated clinic for MSM communities in Kisumu.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: Adapted USAID-PEPFAR Gender and Sexual Diversity trainings to suit local contexts in India, Cambodia, and Myanmar, training over 150 government health policy officials, representatives from public health NGOs, and US State Department staff.
profile_positions.title: Country Trainer

profile_positions.description: Drafted SOGIE-inclusive language recommendations for the World Bank Environmental and Social Safeguards Review process. Engaged LGBTIQ civil society in World Bank consultations in India around the safeguards review process.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description: Selected as an Atlas Service Corps Fellow. Served at the Human Rights Campaign in their new Global Engagement Program. Mobilized local LGBTIQ diaspora communities and refugees in times of global human rights violations against LGBTIQ individuals. Served as primary liaison and advisor for LGBTIQ rights in the Asia-Pacific region at HRC Global.
profile_positions.title: Global Engagement Fellow

volunteer_experiences.description:
Founded in Hong Kong in 2016 and now based in Australia, Planet Ally's mission is to live on a planet of allies.

We are a queer feminist-led international nonprofit dedicated to allyship and advocacy for people with diverse sexual orientations, gender identities and sex characteristics (SOGIESC).

We believe allyship has no borders. Online, on the ground and when travelling; we stand in solidarity to hold and create safe spaces, resources and platforms that protect and empower communities and human rights defenders to advance their human rights and dignity.
